alert.note: Alert for Clay; East Otter Tail; Grant; West Otter Tail; Wilkin (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 27 at 3:53AM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...Impacts from snow and blowing snow are possible Tuesday night into Wednesday... Low pressure will move through South Dakota Tuesday night. Snow with this system will spread into south central North Dakota Tuesday afternoon and then into parts of southeastern North Dakota and west central Minnesota Tuesday night and end on Wednesday. The main impact area will be along and south of Interstate 94. A narrow band of heavy snow is possible with this system but its location is highly uncertain and could end up in northern South Dakota vs southern North Dakota. Gusty north to northwest winds will develop late Tuesday night into Wednesday over southeastern North Dakota but the strength of these winds and impacts due to blowing snow will depend on track and intensity of the low pressure system. Stay tuned for updated forecasts.

area.areaDesc: Clay; East Otter Tail; Grant; West Otter Tail; Wilkin
